title: Do you think the soul of Hitler was allowed to reincarnate? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. According to both Hinduism (Sanatana Dharma) and Buddhism (Buddha Dharma) reincarnation (the transmigration of the Atman, or True Self) or rebirth (the formation of subsequent life-spans in the style of progression) will happen always, because they are natural laws. They depend upon one universal law - the law of karma - cause and effect or casuality. So long as there is karma - volitional acts commited that havent yet been manifested in the form of results - there will be the formation of a subsequent life (either endowed by the same soul, or just a new life, attached to the previous only by means of casual dependence). So if we speak of soul, or Atman, we speak of reincarnation - and yes, Hitler commited huge act that influenced the world, producing outcomes that relate to heavy consequences he brought on the world - so the Atman will be stuck with a heavy load of karmic debt that it must live out, as to restore its own balance and contribute to the balance of the whole (Brahman) - for this to happen and for all the consequences to be lived out be the Atman, it will require enumerous lifespans. In both traditions karma also relates to merit, merit which will determine a good amount of the conditions of successive lives, thus, if the accumulation of negative karma (or bad karma) is excessive (given genocides, pride, killing, torturing, propagating ignorance etc) multiple reincarnations/rebirths may take place in lower realms of existence, within the Samsaric existence. Such worlds are Hells, Hungry Ghosts and animals. Infact if Karmic debt and ignorance are too strong, a being might fall to the lowest realms of existence, and will have to gradually, through many successive lives, generate merit and unclutter the perception, as to gradually take births in higher realms - passing through Hells, hungry spirits, animals and finally humans. Literally every political action he took was ultimately motivated by this idea. And if a man uses every energy he has, up to the moment of his death, to foster what can only be described as evil, is his place not among the lowest of the low?
